cshelp.title: Host Update
cshelp.shortdesc: The Host Update page shows information about the host system.

csbody.p: Click the following sections to display information about the host:

dlentry.dd: This section displays information for all of the packages that have updates available, including package name, version, architecture, and repository. You can update all of the packages listed by selecting Update All. You cannot select individual packages for updates.

This section displays repositories that are associated with the host system. You can add, enable, edit, or remove repositories. Adding a repository associates it with the host system while enabling a repository allows the host to access it. If your system is based on Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Fedora, you can add yum repositories. If your system is Ubuntu or Debian, then add deb repositories.
If you are working with yum repositories, you can add a GPG check to verify that a package from this repository have not been corrupted. Select a repository and then Edit. Select Yes to enable GPG Check and then enter a URL to the GPG key file for the repository.
